speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: SCENE VI. Another part of the plains.

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: Enter AJAX

speaker: AJAX
text_entry: Troilus, thou coward Troilus, show thy head!

speaker: AJAX
text_entry: Enter DIOMEDES

speaker: DIOMEDES
text_entry: Troilus, I say! where's Troilus?

speaker: AJAX
text_entry: What wouldst thou?

speaker: DIOMEDES
text_entry: I would correct him.

speaker: AJAX
text_entry: Were I the general, thou shouldst have my office

speaker: AJAX
text_entry: Ere that correction. Troilus, I say! what, Troilus!

speaker: AJAX
text_entry: Enter TROILUS

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: O traitor Diomed! turn thy false face, thou traitor,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: And pay thy life thou owest me for my horse!

speaker: DIOMEDES
text_entry: Ha, art thou there?

speaker: AJAX
text_entry: I'll fight with him alone: stand, Diomed.

speaker: DIOMEDES
text_entry: He is my prize; I will not look upon.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Come, both you cogging Greeks; have at you both!

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Exeunt, fighting

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Enter HECTOR

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: Yea, Troilus? O, well fought, my youngest brother!

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: Enter ACHILLES

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: Now do I see thee, ha! have at thee, Hector!

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: Pause, if thou wilt.

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: I do disdain thy courtesy, proud Trojan:

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: Be happy that my arms are out of use:

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: My rest and negligence befriends thee now,

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: But thou anon shalt hear of me again;

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: Till when, go seek thy fortune.

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: Exit

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: Fare thee well:

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: I would have been much more a fresher man,

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: Had I expected thee. How now, my brother!

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: Re-enter TROILUS

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Ajax hath ta'en AEneas: shall it be?

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: No, by the flame of yonder glorious heaven,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: He shall not carry him: I'll be ta'en too,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Or bring him off: fate, hear me what I say!

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: I reck not though I end my life to-day.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Exit

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Enter one in sumptuous armour

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: Stand, stand, thou Greek; thou art a goodly mark:

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: No? wilt thou not? I like thy armour well;

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: I'll frush it and unlock the rivets all,

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: But I'll be master of it: wilt thou not,

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: beast, abide?

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: Why, then fly on, I'll hunt thee for thy hide.

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: Exeunt
